answers.answer: I'm really sorry you are having all these problems. I have been struggling with depression and anxiety myself. I know it is hard to deal with but you should never give up. You've come this far already. Maybe you just need someone to talk to? I know it has helped me to talk about what bothers me. Maybe this is all brought about from your image issues? I had preeclampsia with my first child and gained over 70 pounds in the last months of my pregnancy. I now how flabby arms and stomach (not the same as you, i know) but I have had image issues ever since. Maybe after resolving some of your image issues, you will feel better about yourself and life. Just think of how much you have accomplished already and when you hit the bottom there is nowhere to go but up.

question: I had gastric bypass surgery over 6 years ago....l have been having problems with depression, due to loss of energy, every time I eat I get tired and sick to my stomach...I have no motivation to do anything...I have chronic pain all the time...every where.  I'm at the end of my rope...attempted suicide a couple of times...I've lost over 115 lbs. and have problems with hypoglycemia and increased heart rate mostly, beside of the stomach upset after each meal.  I'm at the end of my rope. I need major cosmetic surgery arms, legs, tummy, and breast implants...of course the first to go...that's another one of my depression problems...oh yeah...I haven't slept without major medication from my psych doc along with my inability to concentrate so adult add was also thrown in there.Thanks,Sabrina Johnson***@****
